data.name: Interlaken Free Walking Tour
data.abstract: Interlaken – a jewel in the midst of the Swiss Alps. A local guide shares exciting facts about Interlaken and its environs with the guests. They will visit secret spots that only the locals know, looking at them through their eyes.
data.description: The very first tour of this kind in Switzerland has been very well received by all guests. The guides are from the region. They know the area, its history and secrets and have excellent language skills, especially in English, but they are fluent in other languages as well. In addition to the professional organisation, the tours are fresh, exciting and entertaining. The two-hour event is free, but the guests have an opportunity to tip the guide at the end.

data.name: Interlaken - the paradise for water sports
data.abstract: The region around Interlaken offers a variety of water sports and thus, fun and excitement for everyone.
data.description:
Whether an intoxicating kayak tour on the glassy surface of Lake Brienz or a ride on the waves of a wild mountain stream; the region around Interlaken offers water sports enthusiasts a large choice. During guided tours, which do not require any prior knowledge, hikers get to enjoy the breathtaking nature or search for the next adrenaline rush.

These are the activities on offer: 

• SUP 
• kayaking 
• canoeing 
• canyoning 
• river rafting 
• boat hire 
• wakesurfing 
• water skiing 
• wakeboarding 
• pedaloing

More information [http://www.interlaken.ch/en/activities-excursions-adventure-festivals/summer-sports-and-adventure/water-sports-interlaken.html]

data.name: Interlaken - First ski experience - Full-day
data.abstract: An all day package especially for first time skiers
data.description:
Full-day special offer for beginner skiers

Are you a beginner looking to try skiing or snowboarding for the first time? Spend a day in the snow and carve out your first turns on simple terrain under the professional instruction of our ski or snowboard instructors. We’ll organise the equipment, ski pass and instruction for you so you can fully concentrate on your snow sports adventure. Lessons are provided in small groups of up to eight people, guaranteeing plenty of fun and maximum success!

Included in the price: 

Full-day ski, pole and helmet hire
Full-day lift pass (valid for the bodmiARENA beginners’ area)
Full day of ski instruction
Transport

data.name: Interlaken - First ski experience - Half-day
data.abstract: This half-day beginners’ course is perfect for anyone looking to take their first foray into the world of skiing. Our professional snow sports instructors will teach you the basics of how to ski over the 2.5-hour course.
data.description:
This half-day beginners’ course is perfect for anyone looking to take their first foray into the world of skiing. Our professional snow sports instructors will teach you the basics of how to ski over the 2.5-hour course. You’ll get the chance to practise your new-found skills on the bodmiARENA, the largest beginners’ ski area in Grindelwald with glorious views of the Eiger’s north face.

Included in the price: 

Collection from your hotel in Interlaken

1/2 day’s ski, boot and helmet hire
1/2 day’s pass
2.5-hour skiing lesson
Collection and return transport

data.name: Funky chocolate club Interlaken
data.description: Welcome to the sweet universe of Tatjana and Michaela. In their chocolate studio in Interlaken the guests produce their own masterpiece from 400 g of Swiss chocolate. The chocolate makers help with melting and decorating. The guests can then take their chocolate souvenir home.

price.description: CHF 65.00 per adult CHF 59.00 per child

data.name: Walking tour in Interlaken
data.description: A walking tour through Interlaken means experiencing the town and its history first hand. The interactive tour is organised by local guides. They take their guests through the vegetable garden of the Zwahlen family, have them taste cheese in stately cellars and show them places that nobody else knows.

data.name: Harderbahn
data.abstract: In just ten minutes, the panorama funicular takes guests from Interlaken up to its local mountain Harder Kulm.
data.description:
For more than 100 years, the funicular has been negotiating the 735 meters of altitude to the Harder Kulm, located at 1322 meters. The journey starts not far from Interlaken Ost station, leads through a charming forest and passes the wildlife park. A five-minute walk takes visitors from the mountain station to the lovely restaurant with turrets and a red tile roof. Next to the restaurant, guests may visit the “Two-Lakes-Bridge” and an airy viewing platform with a glass area in its floor. From there, truly deep sights can be seen and the magnificent view to Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Brienz and Thun can be savoured.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1322 m a.s.l. Arrival: Walkway (7 min) from Interlaken Ost station to Harder railway, funicular to Harder Kulm Timetable: Operates during the summer season in 30-minute intervals.Timetable [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/live/operating-info/]

Travel duration to summit: 10 mins Attractions: “Floating” triangular viewing platform Culinary aspects: Pavilion style restaurant
Specials: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/harder-kulm/]



MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=HarderKulm]

data.name: Bernese Oberland – Railway
data.abstract: The Bernese Oberland valley railroad was opened in 1890 and has been been electrified since 1914. It connects Interlaken (Interlaken East) with Grin with Grindelwald and Lauterbrunnen. Besides serving the resort towns, it also enables access to the world famous Jungfraujoch-Top of Europe.
data.description:
As a rule two trains coupled together ride up to Zweilütschinen where they are separated. One train travels to Grindelwald, the other one to Lauterbrunnen. 

The Bernese Oberland valley train presents itself as a modern shuttle that opens up the tourism centers in the Eiger, Mönch & Jungfrau Region.

data.name: Zentralbahn
data.abstract: The Zentralbahn connects Lucerne and Engelberg, passing through Stans and also runs between Lucerne and Interlaken East (see GoldenPass Line) passing by Sarnen and the Brünig Pass.
data.description:
Routes:
Lucerne - Stans - Engelberg (- Titlis)
Lucerne - Sarnen - Brünig - Meiringen - Interlaken East

In a bit less than an hour, the Zentralbahn brings you from Lucerne with its glittering lake to the fascinating Alpine world of Engelberg, home to one of Switzerland's famous cloisters. 

Getting there is half the fun and so it is with this trip that goes through many charming villages and unique vista points. 

Option: Ascend Mount Titlis with the world's first rotating cable car. Once there, admire the glacier and the grandiose alpine panorama from an altitude of 3020 m a.s.l. or visit the Ice Grotto, the Glacier Park, enjoy a ride on the chair-lift «Ice Flyer» or test your mettle on a «Trottibike». 


BRÜNIG SAFARI AND LIVEGUIDE

Brünig Safari [http://www.zentralbahn.ch/en/node/70]From May until October, you can discover 13 native wild animals – made from wood! They are positioned in their natural environments along the Giswil – Meiringen line so as to be visible from the train. The Brünig Safari flyer contains interesting and unusual details about the animals and their lifestyles.

LiveGuide [http://www.zentralbahn.ch/en/node/322] Thanks to the multimedia LiveGuide app, travellers obtain background information on the Zentralbahn, the route and the most fascinating sights along the way. A short film also shows the loveliest points on the route from the driver's vantage point.

data.name: Funky Chocolate Club
data.abstract: In the Chocolate Laboratory® at the Funky Chocolat Club in Interlaken, guests will be supplied with aprons, chef hats and all the ingredients. Professional chocolatiers will share the techniques, tips and tricks of tempering of chocolate, melting, pouring and filling molds.
data.description:
Visitors of the Funky Chocolat Club can learn how to taste chocolate like a professional Swiss connoisseur. Types, quality and cocoa percentage can be recognised after this introduction. Furthermore, own chocolate masterpieces can be created and decorated within the Chocolate Laboratory with the help of professional chocolatiers. 

The chocolate dream is not over yet. The site inlcudes two more attractions where relishing the delicious chocolate is possible: 

Chocolate shop 

Organic- and fair trade chocolate from certified producers can be bought here. You will also find vegan, dairy-free, gluten-free or nut-free varieties. 

Chocolate bar 

Hot chocolate, chocolate fondue and chocolate-dipped strawberrys are served

data.name: Photo Spot St. Beatus Caves
data.abstract: In the St. Beatus Caves by Lake Thun near Interlaken. Explore around one kilometre of safe and well-lit walkways inside the mountain. Discover stalactites and stalagmites that have been formed by nature over millions of years as you immerse yourself in this unique underground world. A visit to the Cave Museum is a chance to learn more about this natural wonder, with an audio guide telling you all you need to know about caves and caving.
data.description:
Address: 
Staatsstrasse 974 in 3800 Sundlauenen near Interlaken

Parking: 
2 car parks (Chrutbach & Staatsstrasse), subject to a charge

Footpath: 
25 minutes, signposted

data.name: GoldenPass Express
data.abstract: The GoldenPass Express redefines the travel experience between Interlaken and Montreux.
data.description:
SEAMLESS TRAVEL EXPERIENCE
The GoldenPass Express provides a seamless and even more comfortable travel experience on one of Switzerland’s most picturesque train routes. The panoramic train will connect Interlaken with Montreux up to four times a day, offering uninterrupted views of the breathtaking panorama.PRESTIGE
The travel class “Prestige” is the centrepiece of the train. It offers everything you would expect from an unforgettable train journey: plenty of privacy, maximum comfort in a small compartment, and an exceptional culinary offering.

Make yourself comfortable on the luxurious and heated leather seats, which can be rotated 180 degrees upon request. The travel class is also elevated by 40 cm compared to the other travel classes, offering you an even better view of the fascinating scenery.

CULINARY DELIGHTS ON THE GOLDENPASS EXPRESS
Local and international delicacies can be ordered in advance, ensuring a perfect start to an exciting journey. For example, how about a glass of champagne and a portion of the finest caviar from Frutigen in Switzerland?

If you prefer to pamper your palate with regional delicacies, you won’t be disappointed with a traditional apéro-plate or a vegetarian alternative. While champagne and caviar are served exclusively in “Prestige” and 1st class, you can enjoy selected dishes from the small but exquisite menu in all travel classes.

WORLD-FAMOUS PLACES, THREE REGIONS
The journey on the GoldenPass Express is like a foray through Switzerland. The trip starts in picturesque Interlaken and continues via Gstaad, Château-d’Oex and Montbovon to Montreux, the journey’s final stop. Of course, you can also start your trip in Montreux.

Interlaken is a great base for numerous activities and boasts incredible views of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Luxurious Gstaad is known for its charming chalets and is a favourite holiday spot among stars and winter sports enthusiasts alike. Château-d’Oex is known for its hot air balloons and, with a little luck, you might spot one aloft. Montreux, of course, is home to the annual Montreux Jazz Festival [https://www.montreuxjazzfestival.com/en/].


SWISSNESS
The GoldenPass Express is a world-first and a Swiss masterstroke. After all, the idea of connecting Interlaken and Montreux without needing to change trains originated more than 100 years ago. The project never materialised, however, because of the different track gauges of the respective sections of the line. But this seemingly impossible challenge could now be solved by an ingenious invention: adjustable bogies.
GOLDENPASS EXPRESS TIMETABLE


The current timetable as well as additional information can be found here [https://www.gpx.swiss/en/pages/timetable].


RESERVATIONS AND SURCHARGES
Due to limited seating capacity, reservations are mandatory in “Prestige” (CHF 49) and strongly recommended for 1st and 2nd class travel. This is in addition to a valid ticket for the selected travel class.

The only thing you might find disappointing? The entire trip lasts just 3 hours 15 minutes. With those stunning views and unrivalled comfort, the journey is just as spectacular as the destination.


SWISS TRAVEL PASS
This route is fully included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) / GA Travelcard, though seat reservations must be paid for separately. 
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

address.name: Compagnie du Chemin de Fer Montreux Oberland bernois SA

data.name: Paradise for adventure and paragliding
data.abstract: Interlaken is the number one place for fun and adventure sports. For paragliding fans, Interlaken has long been known for its excellent flying opportunities and nearly year-round good conditions.
data.description:
On a round tour of the Alps you can enjoy the high-alpine panorama, or on a hang-gliding or paragliding trip you can admire the scenery somewhat more closely while a parachute jump will certainly get your adrenalin going.

Tandem flights: in Interlaken there is a wide range of unique opportunities for paragliding and seeing extraordinary views of the lakes and mountains. As a passenger, you need no previous experience; you are given a few instructions and then a few steps later you lift off with your pilot. Getting an unusual bird's eye view of the unique Jungfrau panorama is sure to make you forget everything else for a while!
Nothing can beat the flight down from the Beatenberg to Interlaken for excitement and a really special experience.

data.name: Raclette rafting
data.abstract: Enjoy a tasty raclette while drifting on a rafting boat from the quay in Bönigen through the ship canal to Interlaken.
data.description: The raft is stable and the tours take place in the evening. While the lights in the houses of Interlaken slowly go on along the banks, guests snuggle down in warm blankets to enjoy a feast of melted cheese and a glass of wine. The views of the snow-covered mountains in the background complement the idyllic cityscape. The reliable guides steer the vessel, so that guests can enjoy the time on the raclette raft.

data.name: Swiss Food and Culture Tour
data.description: Following a culinary introduction to Swiss food and culture with a cheese tasting in the centre of Interlaken, you will visit a chocolate shop and a local woodcarver, who specialises in traditional handicrafts from the Bernese Oberland. Finally, you will discover a local farm, where the farmer will guide you around key areas of the yard.

data.name: In your element
data.abstract: Experience the magical forces between the mountains and valleys: untouched nature, crystal-clear waters and snow-covered peaks provide a sense of wellbeing. Romantic hideaways promise unparalleled relaxation.
data.description:
Some places in the world just make you want to sing with joy. There are also atmospheric hotels to inspire you. Around Interlaken, unique hideaways can be found that promise a relaxing break from everyday life. The power of water is everywhere: The deep blue waters of Lake Thun, the magical turquoise waters of Lake Brienz, and the deafening Giessbach Falls are just as impressive in winter, too. The Seehotel Bären is a refuge of calm and well-being surrounded by crystal clear waterfalls, tranquil mountain lakes and energising alpine landscapes. When Monique Werro brought Indian medicine to Switzerland 24 years ago, some thought it was a sect. Today, Ayurveda is a recognised medical wellness treatment. The most ancient and comprehensive of all known health systems, this natural approach to medicine from India focuses on the unity of body, mind and soul. Food is also a big part of the Ayurvedic health programme. Chef Syril Josef spoils guests with Ayurvedic delicacies and Indian specialities. Ayurveda represents a holistic approach. As well as looking at the many aspects of human health, it takes into account how a person’s environment, such as the magical Brienzersee, can have a positive impact on healing.

Final tip:
For a particularly delicious way to relax and pamper yourself, look no further than Brienz, where cheese fondue is served outdoors in wooden hot tubs.

For reservation:

Seehotel Bären
Hauptstrasse 72
3855 Brienz
Phone: +41 (0)33 951 24 12
ayurveda@seehotel-baeren-brienz.ch
https://www.interlaken.ch/en/poi/ayurveda-at-the-seehotel-baeren [https://www.interlaken.ch/en/poi/ayurveda-at-the-seehotel-baeren]

data.name: By E-bike through the Oberland
data.description: A guide from Interlaken who is familiar with the area leads the bike tour through the holiday region. With the E-bike, the group effortlessly discovers beautiful places away from the masses of tourists. They rest at a village fountain or on a farm. Individual E-bike tours are also available for groups.

price.description: CHF 79.00 per adult CHF 59.00 per child CHF 0.00 incl. equipment

data.name: Live Escape Adventure
data.abstract: MysteryRooms is a special Escape games, adventure games and team building events company. Whether for singles, couples, large groups, or corporate customers MysteryRooms develops special experience events that not only guarantee a high fun factor, but also promote team spirit and also require logical thinking.
data.description:
At the Interlaken location, there are two MysteryRooms that promise a lot of puzzle fun:

"The Secret of the Captain" is our game of chance and is particularly well suited as a first experience. The players are in the nostalgically furnished room of the Captain. The innovative rippled design offers exciting challenges in the areas of combining & concentrating, searching & finding as well as dexterity and sensor technology. A game that is played with all your senses.

Mind Games
The space of the player
Modern design, high-tech puzzles of cables, lights and computers and board games combine to make this interactive puzzle fun. You are in the room of the player, who seems to be a very sophisticated fellow and puts you to the test with tricky puzzles. You do not need to be a chess world champion to play mind games, but logical thinking and team spirit, as well as skill, is important to unlock the player's secret

data.name: Grindelwald First
data.abstract: The First is an ideal starting point for action-packed hikes, the new “First Cliff Walk by Tissot” being a prime example.
data.description:
The cable car whisks you in three stages from the valley station to Grindelwald First at 2,168 metres above sea level, a hotspot for connoisseurs and adventurers alike. The summit tempts visitors with breathtaking views of the north face of the Eiger and wonderful hikes. Lasting around two hours, the leisurely hike to the Bachalpsee lake is a must for anyone visiting the First area. The snow-capped Alpine peaks are reflected in the crystal-clear blue water – a pure mountain idyll!

Whether you opt for the 800-metre First Flyer zipline or a high-octane scooter ride, a rush of speed and adrenaline is guaranteed. The First Flyer enables brave souls to glide through the air for 800 metres at speeds of up to 84km/h. Children can enjoy the 700-square metre playground at the Bort middle station.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 2,166 metres above sea level How to get there: Train from Interlaken to Grindelwald, walk through the village (20 minutes), three-stage gondola to First Timetable: Operates during the summer season (April to October) Journey time: 25 minutes to the summit Attractions: First Flyer, First Cliff Walk, hike to the Bachalpsee lake, mountain hike to the Faulhorn and on to Schynige Platte (only in summer), high-altitude hike to Grosse Scheidegg (bus connections in summer) Food and drink: “Restaurant First” with seating for 350, sun terrace with seating for 300
Special comments: First Mountain Cart from Schreckfeld to Bort Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard: 
Your return ticket to the Grindelwald valley station is included in the price. Buy your discounted cable car tickets here [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/grindelwaldfirst/]. 



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=First(Grindelwald)]

data.name: Schynige Platte
data.abstract: This great experience starts right when guests step into the coaches of the nostalgic cog railway. And the higher the train climbs, the more breathtaking becomes the mountain view that reveals itself.
data.description:
Guests visiting the Schynige Platte, located right at the heart of the Jungfrau region, on the historic cog railway instantly feel carried back to the Belle Époche. The wooden benches in the coaches of the nostalgic train as well as the vintage rolling stock dating from the nineteenth century exude the flair of times long past and revive the spirit of a bygone era.

 The mountain station at 1,967 meters is the starting point for various delightful circular hikes. It’s also home to the Alpine Botanic Garden [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/alpine-botanic-garden/] with some 800 plant species. The magnificent view can best be savoured from the panorama restaurant “Schynige Platte”, where guests are treated to delicious Swiss specialities as well as international dishes.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1,967 m.a.s.l. Arrival: Railway from Interlaken Ost to Wilderswil, cog railway to Schynige Platte Timetable: Operates only during summer (June to October) Travel duration to summit: 52 minutes Attractions:  * Coach drive on the steep cog railway
 * Perfect panoramic view of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Thun and Brienz
 * Free admission to the Botanic Alpine Garden with roughly 800 alpine flowers and plant species
 * “Swiss Flower Panorama Trail” with photo spot
 * Lily’s alpine playground and treasure hunt

Food & beverage:  * Mountain hotel with restaurant and spacious sun terrace
 * Snack-hut directly at the Schynige Platte station
 * “Bistro Breitlauenen” (intermediate station)

Specials: Daylong hike Faulhorn-Grindelwald/First, daily musical entertainment of Alphorn blowers, nature cinema and small railway exhibition in the mountain hotel Schynige Platte, barbecue area and leisurely panorama circular hiking trails (30 minutes to 2.5 hours), nostalgic steam train rides
Please note: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass / GA travelcard
Buy your tickets upon arrival at the station or online [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/schynige-platte/schynige-platte-ticket/] 

MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=SchynigePlatte ]

data.name: Trail of the Three Waterfalls
data.abstract: Water may splash, and it can also babble, hiss, roar and thunder. For an exhilarating hike try the Trail of the Three Waterfalls from Bönigen via Iseltwald to Brienz.
data.description:
Begin of tour: ship station Bönigen Point of arrival: ship station Brienz Access starting point: bus, train or ship Access point of arrival: bus, train or ship Physical fitness: medium Difficulty: medium Hiking time: Total 5h15 / sections 2-4h possible Length: 18.2 km 
This hike is a very special experience for families as it is for all hikers young and old. The walk takes you to three spectacular waterfalls in the Interlaken holiday region. Depending on fitness levels the trail can be covered at one time or in three easy stages.

From Bönigen, Iseltwald, Giessbach and Brienz each of the other stations may be reached by boat, bus or train.

data.name: Hang-gliding
data.description: Nowhere else is the view of the mountains and lakes of the Oberland more beautiful than high above Interlaken. Tandem flights are available with an experienced hang-glider pilot. The hang-gliding season is a bit longer than the paragliding season – from April to November.

data.name: Eiger-Rotstock - via ferrata with a feel of the North Face
data.abstract: The via ferrata on the Rotstock, 260 metres in length, is a route for via ferrata walkers and experienced mountain walkers with a head for heights (and with the right safety equipment). The key to the climb is the vertical section immediately after the start. In the event of snow, strong rain or ice, this is very definitely not a route to be climbed. Like anywhere else on the Eiger, rock-falls cannot be ruled out.
data.description:
Difficulty
K2. Slightly to moderately difficult.
Valley/Starting-point:
Eigergletscher station (2,320 m), by rail from Interlaken Ost via Wengen or Grindelwald and Kleine Scheidegg (2,061 m).

Walk-in
From the Eigergletscher station, follow the Eiger Trail to the grassy hillock at Wart, and then follow paths up to the start point at 2,400 m, behind a mountain-top, with the Rotstockschlucht gorge immediately to your left: 45 minutes. 
Eiger-Rotstock via ferrata:
The course of the route via the new-old via ferrata is easily visible; easy walking sections are marked only with cairns. From the saddle of Rotstock, you quickly climb in stages onto the flat peak of Rotstock (2,663 m), with sheer faces on all sides; 1 hour 15 minutes from the start. 

Descent
Head back to the saddle and then to the south-west, across scree and slab sections (cairns and fixed ropes) down to the Eigergletscher station; 45 minutes. 


[/imglib/USP/k_buch.jpg] Quelle:
Eugen E. Hüsler/Daniel Anker: Wandern vertikal. Die Klettersteige der Schweiz, AT Verlag, Baden 2004  

Region: Bernese Oberland, North Wall of the Eiger 
Peak: Rotstock (2,663 m)
Time required: climb 2 hours, descent 45 minutes.
Variation in height: climb and descent 420 m.

For this trail, we recommend checking with the local tourism organization [https://grindelwald.swiss/en/service/operating-status/status-of-installations.html] in advance to confirm if it is open.

data.name: Sporty Lütschine
data.abstract: One of the best rafting trips of Switzerland. Rapid and demanding river, with the most beautiful and picturesque finishing spots of all rafting tours of Switzerland. No prior experience necessary.
data.description:
The Lütschine is one of the most interesting rafting rivers of Switzerland. Originating from Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau, the famous Swiss mountains, it carries their glacier water straight to Interlaken and into the Brienzer Lake. An alpine river situated in a terrific mountain and lake setting! 

INFORMATION
River: Lütschine
Section: Lütschental – Bönigen, approx. 15 km
Activities: rafting
Landscape: +++
Action factor/level of difficulty: +++
Suited for families: ++
Suited for large groups (30+ persons): +++
Minimum age: 16 years
Season: May – August/September

data.name: “Prem Patra” – the love letter
data.description: This tour goes back to the beginnings of Bollywood in Switzerland. The guests visit the locations where the classics were filmed between 1964 and 1970, e.g. “An Evening in Paris”or “Prem Pujara”. In Interlaken, in the Aare Gorge and at Hotel Grimsel Hospiz the guests reawaken the splendid moments on screen.

price.description: CHF 0.00 excl. food CHF 0.00 incl. transport CHF 350.00 per person

data.name: Fixed Rope Park on Mt. Rugen
data.description:
Outdoor Interlaken inaugurates a fixed rope park in the Wagern Gorge on the Rugen. Nine Parcours of different lengths, difficulty and heights are planned in a beautiful forest with granite blocks dating from the last Ice Age, 18,000 years ago. This is an adventure for the entire family against the backdrop of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.
The fixed rope park is a 15-minute hike away from the train station Interlaken West. Parking is available.

data.name: River rafting Lütschine
data.description: The mighty Lütschine river offers exciting wildwater rafting, creating rapids as it surges down from the mountains. Led by an experienced guide, this rafting tour takes you on an exhilarating ride from Interlaken to turquoise Lake Brienz, where the journey comes to a tranquil end.

data.name: A trip for those in the know
data.description: Many Indian movies were made in the Lake Geneva region. The Bollywood tour starts in Interlaken and continues to three historic castles and to Lake Geneva and the UNESCO world heritage site of Lavaux. The guides know many of the details about the films made with Indian movie stars in this area.

price.description: CHF 0.00 excl. food CHF 0.00 incl. transport

data.name: Heiligenschwendi's Christmas path
data.abstract: On the Heiligenschwendi Christmas trail, six nativities tell the traditional history of Christmas in a most original way, with life-sized figures and animals.
data.description:
Ideal for a trip outdoors and to escape the end-of-year stress, the Heiligenschwendi Christmas trail lights up for visitors every evening during the Advent period. The life-sized figures and animals have waited all year to take up their place in the heights of Heiligenschwendi. The six nativities spread out along the trail are a fun and enjoyable way of rediscovering the stories of Christmas as a family. Depending on how fast you walk, the tour lasts between 30 and 45 minutes. The Christmas trail is not advisable for people who have difficulty walking or who are in a wheelchair.

More information under: https://www.interlaken.ch/en/experiences/tour/weihnachtsweg-heiligenschwendi [https://www.interlaken.ch/en/experiences/tour/weihnachtsweg-heiligenschwendi]

data.name: Golf in the Bernese Oberland region
data.abstract: The majestic Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau summits, crystal-clear lakes and picturesque villages of the Bernese Oberland present a natural paradise for all nature lovers.
data.description:
The unique surroundings in which the golfing greens of the region are discovered are something not to be missed! With Thun and Interlaken additionally inviting you to shop in elegant boutiques surrounded by stunning lake and mountain scenery.GOLF COURSES
9-hole golf course:

Golf Club Thunersee, Thun [http://www.golfthunersee.ch/]

18-hole golf courses: 

Golfclub Interlaken-Unterseen, Interlaken [http://www.interlakengolf.ch/ ]
[http://www.golfmountain.ch/golfmountain/golfplatz-und-driving-range/ ]
